      • addPlayer

        public java.lang.String addPlayer(java.lang.String nickname,
                                  int score,
                                  int level,
                                  int numberOfLifes,
                                  java.lang.String name)
        name: addplayer
        adds a player to the player array
        pre: player data must be different from null
        post: the player shall be registered and saved in a position of the array.
        Parameters:
        nickname - is a String data type that serves as the unique identifier (id) of the player.
        score - is an int data used to store the player's score.
        level - is an int data that serves to determine the level where the player is at the moment.
        numberOfLifes - is an int data that stores the number of lives a player currently has.
        name - is a String that stores the player's real name
        Returns:
        a message of the positive method result if it was recorded negative if it could not be recorded

      • searchPlayer

        public boolean searchPlayer(java.lang.String nickname)
        name:searchPlayer
        search if the player is repeated or not
        pre: the player must exist
        post: it will be determined whether the player is a repeat player or not.
        Parameters:
        nickname - is a String that stores the id of the player that you want to know if it is repeated or not.
        Returns:
        existPlayer will send a determination as to whether or not the player already exists.

      • addlevel

        public void addlevel(int id,
                     int requiredPoints,
                     int amountOfTreasures,
                     int cuantityOfEnemys)
        name:addlevel
        adds a level to the level array
        pre: level data must be different from null
        post:the level must be registered
        Parameters:
        id - is an int data that serves as the unique identifier for the level
        requiredPoints - is an int data that serves to store the score required to be in that level.
        amountOfTreasures - is a data that int that serves to determine the amount of treasures that are currently in the level.
        cuantityOfEnemys - is an int data that serves to determine the number of enemies in the level.

      • registerEnemy

        public java.lang.String registerEnemy(int enemylevel,
                                      java.lang.String enemyName,
                                      int scoreRemoved,
                                      int enemyScoreGive,
                                      int typeenemy)
        name:registerEnemy
        adds a level to the Enemy in enemy array
        pre: Enemy data must be different from null
        post:will be sent to the method addEnemy in level
        Parameters:
        enemylevel - is an int data that serves to store the data of the level at which the enemy is to be registered.
        enemyName - is an String data that serves as the unique identifier for the enemy in a specific level
        scoreRemoved - is an int data that serves to store how many points the enemy takes away from a player if defeated .
        enemyScoreGive - is a data that serves to store how many points enemy gives to player in case of defeat.
        typeenemy - is an int data that serves to store the type of the enemy give by the user.
        Returns:
        a message of the positive method result if it was recorded negative if it could not be recorded

        nameOfTreasure - is an String data that serves as the identifier of a treasure
        image - is an String data that serves to store the url given by the user.
        scoreGranted - is a data that serves to store how many points the treasure gives to player in case of find.
        Returns:
        a message of the positive method result if it was recorded negative if it could not be recorded
